channel.title: Installing jdk
channel.description:
I currently have xUbuntu (getting used to linux os's)
I did java -version in my terminal
came up with this [code]nate@ubuntu:~$ sudo bash [sudo] password for nate: root@ubuntu:~# java -version The program 'java' can be found in the following packages: * gcj-4.4-jre-headless * openjdk-6-jre-headless * cacao * gij-4.3 * jamvm Try: apt-get install <selected package> root@ubuntu:~# [/code]
how do I install it?

item.title: Installing jdk
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk sun-java6-jre sun-java6-plugin

If that doesn’t work, (ie. Can’t find packages), try enabling the extra repositories.

http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/sources

Read full topic

item.title: Installing jdk
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

I currently have xUbuntu (getting used to linux os’s)

I did java -version in my terminal

came up with this

[code]nate@ubuntu:~$ sudo bash
[sudo] password for nate:
root@ubuntu:~# java -version
The program ‘java’ can be found in the following packages:

  • gcj-4.4-jre-headless
  • openjdk-6-jre-headless
  • cacao
  • gij-4.3
  • jamvm
    Try: apt-get install
    root@ubuntu:~# [/code]

how do I install it?

Read full topic
